title: UConn vs. Cincinnati
text:
Friday, October 23, 2015 11:59 PM EDT 
UConn vs. Cincinnati UConn (3-4, 1-2) at Cincinnati (3-3, 0-2)When: 4:30 p.m. todayTV, Radio: CBS Sports Network, WTIC-AM (1080)Series: South Cincinnati leads, 9-2.Worth noting: UConn plays its fourth road game in six weeks ... UConn coach Bob Diaco was the defensive coordinator at Cincinnati in 2009. The Bearcats went 12-1 overall, won the Big East title and played in the Sugar Bowl that season ... Cincinnati leads the American Athletic Conference in passing offense and first downs, and is third in total offense ... UConn linebacker Marquise Vann, one of the Huskies' captains, hails from Cincinnati ... The Bearcats have scored at least 34 points in each of the last four games against UConn and have posted 41 points in each of the last two meetings ... UConn running back Arkeel Newsome ranks 26th nationally in all-purpose yards at 134.9 per game ... UConn is plus-six in turnover margin and its 14 forced turnovers is tied for 17th in the country and leads the AAC ... Cincinnati has not won back-to-back games this year ... Cincinnati's three defeats have come by a combined 29 points.Scouting reportUConn will win if: Its defense stops giving up big plays, which is something Cincinnati is good at doing. The Huskies were killed by big plays last week against South Florida. Diaco said he considers that defensive performance, which was otherwise good, to be a blip. It has to be if the Huskies stand a chance to pull off the upset.Cincy will win if: Its offense is its typical self. If the Bearcats go up and down the field with ease, the Huskies have no chance because they can't score enough. UConn has to find a way to keep its offense on the field for extended periods so the defense can be fresh when it has to go up against that high-tempo Bearcats attack.Key matchupsUConn DBs vs. Cincy WRs: Cincy can run the ball effectively, but would much rather heave the ball all over the place. UConn's secondary needs to be ready for that.UConn D vs. Cincy O: Cincinnati has a whopping 15 turnovers already. UConn needs to add to that total.UConn O vs. third down: As porous as Cincinnati has been defensively, it is awfully good on third down, allowing opponents to convert on just 25 percent of its attempts.UConn Cincy
